3.64. 
Conciliation between spouses 
1. The court must take measures to reconcile the spouses. 
2. The court must offer to the spouses an amicable settlement of their property, the maintenance and upbringing of their minor children, the place of residence of the minor children, the arrangements for contact with the separated parent, and the other consequences of the dissolution of the marriage. If the spouses agree, Article 3.53(3) and (4) of this Code shall apply. 
3. The court shall apply the measures provided for in Article 3.54(2) and (3) of this Code, unless their application is likely to be detrimental to the interests of the spouse requesting the divorce or of the minor children of the spouses.
